name: Adv Flow: README
info:
- If you do not want to have the database stuff, delete the "Postgres DB" group.
The FTPS fetch and filament type setter will still work without it

- If you have a print start and it didn't fetch the image right or the weight or type,
go back here to the nodered flow and click the button on the "FORCE FETCH" inject node.

name: Version 2.1.3
info:
Version 2.1.3: 2024-0?-??
- Fixed up some logic around http print info mapping and backup attempts
- Added Print Weight and Print Cost sensors
- Fix for makerworld prints on P1 series not working for FTP File backup try when only one print is available
 - Turns out, gcode_file does not contain plate info in this case. Which makes no sense and would even break bambustudio
- Major rework of adv flow
 - Removed dependency on zip palette and python palette (or python in general)
 - Swapped to exec nodes to run terminal commands for unzip and FTPS
 - organized into groups better
===
Version 2.1.2: 2024-04-27
- Added backup check for when "print again" is hit with local FTP prints.
 - Now the basic flow stores for 3 days subtask_ids and their print info, so when print again is clicked, it will look into their to try to find the correct print file to download.
 - Does not currently support HTTP (re)prints. (This is a WIP, need to better test)
===
Version 2.1.1: 2024-04-10
- Added version checking support for flow

===
Version 2.1.0: 2024-03-13
- Added plate_id column in db, so you can track which plate a print used
- Remove some HA nodes in favour of flow variables set continuously from retained mqtt states from basic flow
- Add more datetime parts to status messages 

===
Version 2.0.11: 2024-01-20
- Added sensors that poll the DB for:
 - total tracked/recorded active printing time
 - total tracked/recorded grams of filament printed
- misc fixes/typos
- fix for gcode parsing missing vendor in recent orcaslicer updates.

===
Version 2.0.10: 2023-12-30
- Sync with basic flow update
- Minor logic change in plate_name extraction if HA fails
- Dashboard support change - print preview is now an image type, not camera

===
Version 2.0.9: 2023-12-11
- Add setting for printer device name from HA
 - this is requires after HA changed their MQTT implementation that f***ed up device names
 - makes it 10x more annoying for configurable dashboards and flows
 - it isn't configured to be used yet as I am attempting a different workaround, but it is ready for debugging and eventual permanent usage.

===
Version 2.0.8: 2023-11-05
- Minor tweaks around logic
- Sync with 2.0.8

===
Version 2.0.7: 2023-10-06
- More GCode parsing
- Multiple DB improvements
 - Material_used_cost is for the overall cost of all materials just as before
 - New progress_done column. To tell you how much progress a print had before it failed. Defaults to 100 for all retroactive prints.
 - New column for filament data.
  - This column is from extracting via the gcode file *if applicable* to get details like profile, cost, weight, type, etc per filament used in a print.
  - By default, it *removes* filament profiles that had 0 weight used. They usually come in if you keep a bunch loaded in bambustudio/orca but don't use them in a print.
 - Separated out the insert updates into a new subgroup.
 - New "manual update" option. Please read the NOTES for it.
- Makerworld prints do *not* get overall weight used or cost of all filaments from gcode. It is missing.
- Grafana dashboards updated to prioritize weight/type/cost from filament_data column. If absent or 0, will pull from the overall material columns.



===
Version 2.0.6: 2023-09-19
- Misc fixes for plate_name and filename
- GCode extraction
- DB Change, new column: material_used_cost
 - The previous columns meant for this were kept around but are still unused in case someone was using them
 - New column is filled in by parsing the GCode file for a print cost 
 - This means you need to make sure your profiles are aligned for filament for their costs to be accurate
 - To simulate retroactively adding this to old print data (default 0.0), check the NOTES node at the bottom of the db postgres group
===
Version 2.0.5: 2023-09-11
- Fix for P1 series start time set from postgres flow being wrong (forgot to multiply epoch by 1000 for human readable override)
- Added catch to HA node for when in P1 series, the start epoch just does not exist at all
- FINALLY FIXED P1 FTP DOWNLOADING
 - turns out, listing from ftp the /cache directory, if it was a P1 it did not prefix the files with the path
- Fixed start epoch resetting for p1 series

===
Version 2.0.4: 2023-09-09
- Additional workarounds for when start epoch is 0 or NaN (HA issues, cache issues, or P1 series issues caused)
 - When start epoch was still read as 0 for db flow, the plate/weight/material inserts also failed
 - Workaround is to have start epoch force created and if HA still reports 0, use a flow-set version which clears on print end.
- More workarounds for plate name/id.

===
Version 2.0.3: 2023-08-20
- Added several workarounds for P1 series to get proper plate name/id
- Added preventative measures in case http request fails when using P1 Cloud MQTT
- Relying on new "Plate name" sensor from HA which requires basic flow 2.0.3+

===
Version 2.0.2: 2023-08-19
- Attempt to fix bug of FTPS flow not triggering
- Fixed bug of db flow with forcing start epoch into db
- Removed all HA State Trigger nodes, replaced with triggers from MQTT updates + manual fetch to HA to get previous and current state. This was done to make *all* node entity id's configurable via input, so there are no "hardcoded" nodes and it can be updated completely via basic flow settings group.
  - This means it will be easy to reconfigure due to a typo or sensor name change.
  - Do note this will mean there is at least a 10 second delay now purposefully on status updates - this was the lowest I could make it guaranteeing the HA history lookup would work.
- Potential fixes for inability to maintain or get a plate id / name, along with workarounds
- Fix for an error message that would sometimes come up for duplicate keys but could be ignored
===
Version 2.0.0: 2023-08-05
- Reset version as new codebase is in a repository now
- Some cleanup
- Reworked FTPS logic - it will prioritize using the MQTT Request msg with a url (FTP or HTTP if cloud) to parse the name. If this fails after 75 seconds, it will attempt the old approach still.
- Removed old HTTP backup method for getting image. Preference to use MQTT, but if you want it back it is easy to make with default nodes.

Rev 46: 2023-05-01
- Change according to main flow for making the mqtt connections easier when importing/generating

===
Rev 39: 2023-04-26
- Added extracting of plate_type for each print in ftp+postgres flow
- Set plate_type sensor on x1c printer based on print details

====
Rev 38: 2023-04-20
- Increased delay when P1P Cloud in fetch

====
Rev 36: 2023-04-07
- Modified FTP flow to handle P1P in cloud Mode 
If p1p cloud is toggled on, instead of FTPS, it will wait for the project file message to printer from mqtt server.
It will then do a GET download of the url from bambu's amazon webserver instead.
- Modified Postgres Table schema, will be automatic upgrade.
- Added a failsafe for start epoch as p1p cloud mode won't have it, this sets it ONLY for the print for DB purposes

====
Rev 33: 2023-03-11
- Changed FTP Image fetch logic. No longer do you need to rely on caching of a digital file or exposing nodered to the internet. Now, an image will be sent through MQTT (dashboard has associated update)

====
Rev 31: 2023-03-05
- General update for syncing

====
Rev 30: 2023-02-25
- Changed image and weight fetching to be fetch for the currently printed plate instead of default plate 1
- Added "Filament Type Setter" to set filament type of printer based on 3mf file via FTPS, instead of relying on AMS in normal flow

Initialize
query:
ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS material varchar(10);
ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS plate_type varchar(15);
ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS filament_data jsonb default '[]';
ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS progress_done numeric default 100;
ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS plate_id varchar(25) default 'unknown';

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS prints (
    id SERIAL,
    start_epoch numeric PRIMARY KEY,
    printer varchar(25) NOT NULL,
    printer_serial varchar(20) NOT NULL,
    name varchar(75) NOT NULL,
    start_time timestamp DEFAULT (now() at time zone 'utc'),
    end_time timestamp,
    initial_kwh numeric DEFAULT 0.0,
    final_kwh numeric DEFAULT 0.0,
    kwh numeric GENERATED ALWAYS AS
  		(
        case WHEN status = 'RUNNING' THEN 0.0
            ELSE final_kwh - initial_kwh
            end
      ) STORED,
    status varchar(10),
    electric_rate numeric NOT NULL,
    electric_cost numeric GENERATED ALWAYS AS ( 
        case WHEN status = 'RUNNING' THEN 0.0
            ELSE ((electric_rate / 100) * (final_kwh - initial_kwh))
            end
      ) STORED,
    material_used numeric default 0.0,
    material_type varchar(10) default 'filament',
    material_price numeric default 0.0,
    material_cost numeric GENERATED ALWAYS AS (
        material_used * (material_price / 1000)
    ) STORED,
    material_description varchar(50),
    material varchar(10),
    plate_type varchar(15),
    filament_data jsonb default '[]',
    progress_done numeric default 100,
    plate_id varchar(25) default 'unknown'
);


--ALTER TABLE prints DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS material_price;
--ALTER TABLE prints DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS material_cost;
ALTER TABLE prints ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS material_used_cost numeric default 0.0;

name: Insert Initial
query:
INSERT INTO prints (
    start_epoch,
    printer,
    printer_serial,
    name,
    initial_kwh,
    status,
    electric_rate,
    progress_done
) SELECT 
    '{{msg.values.start_epoch}}',
    '{{msg.values.printer}}',
    '{{msg.values.printer_serial}}',
    '{{msg.values.name}}',
    '{{msg.values.initial_kwh}}',
    '{{msg.values.status}}',
    '{{msg.values.electric_rate}}',
    0
 WHERE NOT EXISTS (select 1 from prints where start_epoch = '{{msg.values.start_epoch}}' and printer = '{{msg.values.printer}}');

name: Insert Update
query:
UPDATE prints SET
    status = '{{msg.values.status}}',
    final_kwh = '{{msg.values.final_kwh}}',
    end_time = (now() at time zone 'utc'),
    progress_done = CASE WHEN '{{msg.values.status}}' = 'FINISH' THEN 100 ELSE prints.progress_done END
WHERE 
    start_epoch = '{{msg.values.start_epoch}}';

name: Insert Energy Table
query:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS energy_reading (
    id SERIAL,
    printer varchar(25) PRIMARY KEY,
    read_time timestamp DEFAULT (now() at time zone 'utc'),
    kwh numeric NOT NULL,
    electric_rate numeric NOT NULL,
    electric_cost numeric GENERATED ALWAYS AS ( 
        case WHEN kwh = 0.0 THEN 0.0
            ELSE ((electric_rate / 100) * (kwh))
            end
      ) STORED
);
COMMIT;

INSERT INTO energy_reading (printer, kwh, electric_rate, read_time) VALUES (
    '{{msg.payload.printer}}',
    '{{msg.payload.kwh}}',
    '{{msg.payload.electric_rate}}',
    (now() at time zone 'utc')
)
ON CONFLICT ON CONSTRAINT energy_reading_pkey
DO UPDATE 
     SET kwh = '{{msg.payload.kwh}}',
     electric_rate = '{{msg.payload.electric_rate}}',
     read_time = (now() at time zone 'utc')
     WHERE energy_reading.printer = '{{msg.payload.printer}}'; 
;

name: EId
EId
NaN Check
If IDLE
Prepare = Running
NOTES 1
info:
Pressing this button will auto update
all prints in the database.

A new column was introduced in 2.0.6
for material_used_cost,
parsed from the gcode file

Since all previous prints will
have it at 0, you can optionally choose
to press this inject node to forcefully
set the cost of each based on their
material used, and an AVERAGE cost for
the filament type

PLEASE SET the average costs per filament
material type in the "COSTS" node

this will permanently update all where
the material used cost is 0.0


Unfortunately, this list is limited to
whatever ends up in the database from
Bambu's filament settings. So nothing for
PLA+ or such.

----
EXAMPLE SCENARIO BELOW PLEASE READ
----
For an example of calculating averages,
let's say I printed 500g (0.5kg) 
of PLA, 1kg of polymaker CosPLA,
and 3.2kg of PLA+ and
that is all in the database as "PLA",
totalling 4.7kg

If my normal PLA costs $28.00 per KG,
CosPLA costs $33.00 per KG,
and PLA $30 per KG,

in total I have 4.7kg of PLA in the DB
but the cost per kg varies

To calculate the average per,
before adding:

[variant cost]: ( [amount of variant in kg] / [total weight of material in db in kg] ) * [cost per kg of variant]
[total = sum of all variant costs]

PLA: (0.5 / 4.7) * 28 = 2.97
cosPLA: (1 / 4.7) * 33 = 7.02
PLA+: (3.2 / 4.7) * 30 = 20.43

Add them together and my average
cost for PLA printed in the past was
$30.42

So for the COSTS node to the right,
for PLA I would put in

30.42

*Alternatively* if you know you spent $28
per kg of PLA, and rarely deviate, you can
just put 28.00


====
When you first import this, all values are 0
 for a predefined list of materials 
 this way if you run it, nothing changes

not all materials may be in the list. If yours isn't
then add it as msg.[name] and set the type to a number,
then insert the value.

materials that will work are ones that you can set from
within bambu studio as a filament type.

THIS WILL BE A ROUGH CALCULATION
and not 100% perfect, but is better than having all 0's


=============

If you regularly print files from Makerworld, you will need to run this often
as makerworld gcode files *do not* contain cost information

name: Org
Insert Update
query:
UPDATE prints SET
    material_used_cost = ((material_used * '{{msg.avg}}') / 1000.0)
WHERE 
    material_used_cost = 0
    AND material = '{{msg.material}}' and material_type = 'filament';

func: rbe

name: Store Print Progress
func:
flow.set("print_progress_pct", msg.payload);
node.status({ fill: "blue", shape: "ring", text: `${msg.payload}%` });

name: Sub
NOTES 2
info:
Running this will update all previous prints prior to 2.0.7

RUN THIS ONCE AFTER UPDATING TO 2.0.7
BUT MAKE SURE TO RUN "Update Material Used Costs" FIRST
IF UPDATING FROM AN OLDER VERSION THAN 2.0.6

--------------------------------------------------------------------

What this does is fill in data for the filament_data column where it previously is empty.

This new column is directly taken from the gcode of each print to be accurate,
HOWEVER for this retroactive updating, it will do it based off of the saved data.

This means for all that are manually updated like this, they will only have:
1 filament
colour: black
profile: Manual
and a special "manual_set":true value in the single filament.

The purposes of this column is to allow advanced parsing of costs / material usage.

However, when this is pulled manually via this, it is already using values based on what exists.
This means for failed prints it is already modified based on print progress.

FOR ALL THAT ARE ADDED THROUGH NORMAL PRINTING
they will not auto update based on print progress if failed.

Hence, a new column, "progress_done" is created so you can use it to calculate advanced metrics.
I already take care of this calc in the grafana dashboards. By default, progress_done is set to 100
this way old data works.

name: U1
U2
U3
U4
Count
query:
SELECT count(*) FROM prints
WHERE filament_data = '[]' and material_type = 'filament' and material is not null;

name: Get Printing Time
query:
select 
      sum(case when prints.status = 'RUNNING' or prints.status = 'PAUSED' 
      then EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM ((now() at time zone 'utc') - start_time)) 
      else EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (end_time - start_time))end), material
from prints 
where printer_serial = '{{msg.printer_serial}}' and material is not null group by material;

name: Get Print Time

func: deadbandEq

name: Get Printing Amount
query:
select 
      sum( CASE WHEN (b->>'used_g')::float = 0.0 and material_used > 0 and most_mat is not null and most_mat = (b->>'type')::text THEN material_used  ELSE ( (b->>'used_g')::float * (progress_done / 100) ) END),
        (CASE when material_type = 'resin' then 'ml' else 'g' end) as "material_unit", (b->>'type')::text as material
      from (
            SELECT JSONB_ARRAY_ELEMENTS(filament_data) as b, material_type, progress_done, material as most_mat, material_used
            from prints 
            where jsonb_array_length(filament_data) != 0 
            and printer_serial = '{{msg.printer_serial}}' and material is not null
      ) as foo 
      group by material, material_type

name: Insert Update (Filament Data)

UPDATE prints SET
    filament_data = $1::jsonb
WHERE 
    start_epoch = '{{msg.start_epoch}}';

name: Convert

msg.params = [JSON.stringify(msg.gcode_data)];
node.send(msg);
